Review: One of the worst RPGs I've ever played, believe me I tried really hard to like it as well as cut it some slack for its age but some of the game's flaws and problems are absolutely inexcusable. The world map is so devoid that it is almost senseless to even have it. The side quests are mostly fetch quests and aren't worth the time in the rewards they give.  You could kill enemies in a random encounter and get 10x the reward plus save half the time. The thing that gets me the most is the shopping and buying equipment.....You can wear two pieces of chainmail for about 30k and it will give you the same protection as a 300-800k suit of armor. The game has almost every aspect of a first generation game rushed out to a new console, with little planning and foresight....with massive padding so they could claim X hours of gameplay. It has very few redeeming qualities (I actually like the chaining system).  The only people recommending this are doing it out of nostalgia and/or haven't completed the game to really see how bad it gets.

It ruins the experience to run through it with hodgepodge armor pieces or varying types. A lot of the classes don't seem balanced properly, judging by the complaints. I recommend playing or watching it for a great story (Even has voices from the tv series) and a decent amount of moral choices to make. I didn't feel they were overall game impacting, but it was fun non the less, on a dragon age genre level. If you are a big fan of the series looking for more story and lore, I recommend it. If you are looking for an awesome in-depth RPG, this probably isn't for you. I'd happily pay $30 bucks for it to help get a sequel out on the market (Non fan biased view probably has ~15 as a proper price)

Review: My overall experience of the game was great. 9/10 Moral Choices: There were some choices in the game, but a bit difficult to actually notice them or understand how to make the choice for a couple of them. Other than that the graphics were fantastic, they paid a decent amount to minor details such as injuries and bandaging them up as the game goes along. Guns: There was a decent variety, but I mostly stuck to the starting weapons, the pistol had amazing accuracy and stopping power, and the rifle had little kickback. Controls: Pretty good with some dashing/sprinting exceptions. IE: Trying to manuever around and taking cover on a column was tough.  Also the toggle mode for sprint was annoying as hell, holding it down and letting go would have been much better. AI: The AI was decent, but at some points there were glaring issues and oddities in their behaviour.  Not enough to detract too much from the gameplay. Some of what these guys were wearing made absolutely no sense for a desert. IE: A super heavy suit of armor Difficulty: Played it on the 2nd hardest mode, felt it was mostly well balanced. Theres a difficuly spike towards the end, which I found very frustrating. I don't think the game was done justice, for my first over the shoulder "FPS" I was quite pleased with it.
